docs.abstract: LinkedIn has found success in China where other American technology companies have largely failed, earning what seems to be tacit approval of government; social network has made several concessions to Chinese authorities, compromising on free expression and relinquishing 7 percent of its local operation to two well-connected Chinese venture capital firms; moves are being closely watched by Silicon Valley as it tries to crack vast Chinese market.
